intro: Skiatophytum flaccidifolium, commonly known as the flaccid-leaf skiatophytum, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the cooler months, typically in spring. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
